head.citation-title: Shear wave velocity of soils and NEHRP site classification map of Chiangrai City, northern Thailand
head.abstracts: Multi-channel surface wave seismic data was acquired at 30 preselected sites in the Chiangrai City area, northern Thailand. The primary goal was to generate the NEHRP (National Earthquake Hazards Reduction Program) soil classification map for Chiangrai City using the average shear wave velocity values derived from the multi-channel analysis of surface wave (MASW) data. The NEHRP map of the study area generated from these data closely matched the surficial geologic map. Areas mapped on the existing surficial geology map as either alluvium or natural levee soils have weighted average shear-wave velocity values of 30 m depth (Vs(30)) ranging from 309 to 354 m/s, corresponding to NEHRP soil class D. Areas mapped as colluviums and valley filled soils, in contrast, have values of 427m/s and corresponding to NEHRP soil class C.
